@SW_Trains A train with seats free just passed through New Malden at exactly the time the cancelled London train was due. Why?!??
When you are cancelling multiple London-bound trains from New Malden @SW_Trains, why not have faster trains do an additional stop???
Flamin' Nora! It's February already! Where did January go?!?

How recently did it become a thing to take to the streets to protest against the result of a democratic election/referendum? Seems fatuous.
I had not clocked that the new @POTUS was teetotal. Imagine that twitter feed if it were alcohol-fuelled...
Underwhelming for an inaugural address and concerned at protectionist rhetoric. But then expectations were pretty low, weren't they?
@asabenn @POTUS Er, it's up to 3.5 million in 5 mins!?!?
Presumably those tartan scarves are a nod to the new President's Scottish heritage?

Of the 8,000+ tracks on my iPod, no fewer than three Christmas songs have been shuffled up in the last hour en route to the office!

A bumper round-up of #Brexit news on @BrexitCentral today, following yesterday's speech by @theresa_may https://t.co/76hIFajU4H
People should now unite behind Theresa May’s positive vision of post-Brexit Britain: @SteveBakerHW on @BrexitCentral https://t.co/Ar1M2QyH8j
According to @BBCr4today the cold weather in the south east of England today is coming from the continent - was it something we said?!
A certain four year old is very excited about his new bed! https://t.co/eLIOtzkJNy
Listen to the first ever @BrexitCentral Podcast with @darrengrimes_, me and @matthew_elliott! https://t.co/0tUbdiYwaQ
Here's @matthew_elliott's take on @theresa_may's #Brexit speech this morning... https://t.co/NLK3pk3Yyx
Journalists are trying to tempt @theresa_may into saying she was wrong to campaign for Remain at the referendum but she is not biting...
We must recognise the need to bring the brightest and the best into the UK while controlling immigration at a UK level, says @theresa_may
All economic indicators since the referendum have been more positive than predicted, @theresa_may reminds @bbclaurak
The losers have a responsibility to respect the legitimacy of the outcome of the referendum, declares @theresa_may
"No deal would be better than a bad deal", insists @theresa_may (Very important that EU knows we're willing to walk away on WTO rules - JI)
A punitive deal to discourage others from leaving would be an Act of calamitous self harm for all of Europe, sad @theresa_may
Economically rational for all to have a free trade agreement: the erection of barriers would mean fewer jobs and less growth - @theresa_may
The vast majority want a positive relationship w/ the EU after Brexit. That's why we want a free trade agreement with the EU - @theresa_may
This is not a time for opposition for opposition's sake, urges @theresa_may. And it's not my job to fill column inches with daily updates
This is a comprehensive and carefully considered plan, says @theresa_may.
I don't want an unlimited transitional status but there will be a phased process of implementation to avoid cliff edges, says @theresa_may
The objectives provide a basis for a new strong and constructive partnership with the EU, says @theresa_may
We must work together more - not less - to deal with cross border crime and terrorist threats, says @theresa_may
Idea of associate membership of the customs union is floated by @theresa_may who wants out of common commercial policy and external tariff
We want greatest possible access to single market with maximum freedom to trade in the EU & the same for EU businesses here: @theresa_may
No more contributions to the EU budget, promises @theresa_may. We may pay specifically to participate in some programmes, she adds
A reminder from @theresa_may that BOTH sides in the referendum campaign said leaving the EU would mean leaving the single market
"What I am proposing cannot mean membership of the single market" - unequivocal from @theresa_may
Also a pledge to protect and maintain workers' rights from @theresa_may
Resolving the rights of EU citizens here and Brits abroad is an early priority - @theresa_may
When immigration get too high, public support falters. @theresa_may may says she knows you cannot control immigration with open borders
Retaining common travel area with Ireland is a priority in and there will remain a special relationship with Ireland - @theresa_may
Objective 2 is a Stronger Britain, says @theresa_may, emphasising support for the Union and involving the devolved nations in the process
First objective from @theresa_may is clarity and certainty. Says final deal WILL be put to a vote in both Houses of Parliament
There is one goal behind the 12 objectives - a positive and constructive partnership with the EU - @theresa_may
We are leaving the EU but we are not leaving Europe, emphasises @theresa_may
The referendum vote was not a rejection of our shared values or a desire to turn the clock back to less peaceful times, says @theresa_may
It's in the UK's interest that the EU succeeds - so all should reflect on the lessons of Brexit, says @theresa_may
Referendum was not a decision to turn inward on the world, says @theresa_may, reminding us of strong global ties around the world.
Game on - Theresa May takes to the stage... https://t.co/6wsR9R7HBR
An audience eagerly awaiting the Prime Minister... https://t.co/Cou6nIxu1B
